problemOverview.title: Local Restaurant Online Ordering Gap
problemOverview.desc: Local restaurants face a dilemma: customers increasingly expect online ordering and delivery options, but platforms like DoorDash and UberEats charge 15-30% commission fees that devastate already thin profit margins. Many family-owned restaurants can't afford professional website development, leaving them stuck between losing customers to competitors or losing profits to platform fees. Meanwhile, customers often prefer supporting local businesses directly but lack an easy way to discover and order from neighborhood restaurants that aren't on major platforms. This creates a gap where both restaurants and customers want a solution, but the current market primarily serves large chains and platform companies rather than local communities.

keyPainPoints.title: High Platform Fees
